summary: This is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List, detailing the travel history of an individual (presumably Jeffrey Epstein) from 2004 to 2019. It shows numerous international flights, primarily between Los Angeles (LAX) and London (LHR), with other destinations including the Bahamas (NAS), Vancouver (YVR), Manila (MNL), and Miami (MIA). The document is marked as confidential and law enforcement sensitive.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The travel record is almost certainly for Jeffrey Epstein, detailing his international flights from 2004 to 2019, with frequent trips between Los Angeles and London.

locations: John F. Kennedy International Airport, New York (JFK)
keyFacts: The document shows extensive international travel by Jeffrey Epstein from 2004 until just weeks before his death in August 2019.
Epstein's most frequent travel route was between Los Angeles (LAX) and London (LHR), with over a dozen recorded trips.
Travel destinations included the Bahamas (NAS), the Philippines (MNL), Canada (YVR), and various US cities, indicating a global pattern of movement.

The last recorded flight was on August 16, 2019, from LAX to LHR, which was shortly before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019 (note: this date appears to be after his death, suggesting a data entry or record-keeping anomaly).
The document is a confidential, law enforcement sensitive TECS record generated by U.S. Customs and Border Protection, indicating official monitoring of his movements.
